list_definition.definition: a shout of approval, encouragement or welcome
to give a shout of approval etc (to)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The crowd cheered the new champion.

list_ex_of_english: Anything which appeared to be revolutionary and different would have his cheers.
Perhaps we would see street parties and people waving and cheering up and down the country.
However, no one should be cheering about the prospect of achieving objective 1 funding because one does not get it for nothing.
The candidates were enthusiastically applauded and greeted with cheers.
The cheering and the noise of the machines is a positive disturbance to the area.
There are some very cheering indications, so far as this country is concerned.
We have certain very cheering aspects of our economy as well as certain depressing ones.
If it was right and worthy of their cheers then, it is right that we should consider that matter fairly now.
